org.jeo.mongo

Class Mapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jeo.mongo.Mapping

  • public class Mapping
extends Object
    Declares mappings of a mongo object/document to a feature.

    This object supports two types of mapping. The first is mapping of to a geometry object with the geometry(String) method. For example consider the following mongo document representing a country: 

     {
   "geometry": {
      "type": "Polygon", 
      "coordinates": [...]
    }, 
    "name": "Canada", 
    "capital": 
      "name": "Ottawa",
      "loc": {
         "type": "Point", 
         "coordinates": [...]
      }
   }
    To map the geometry of the country itself, along with the geometry of the captital city: 
    
 new Mapping().geometry("geometry").geometry("captial.loc");
    The first mapped geometry is considered to be the primary geometry.

    The second type of mapping is providing a root path to an object whose properties should be considered properties of the feature with the properties(String) method. For example, consider the following country object: 

     {
   "geometry": {
      "type": "Polygon", 
      "coordinates": [...]
    }, 
    "info": {
      "name": "Canada",
      "population": 35056064 
    }
    To map the object: 
    
 new Mapping().geometry("geometry").properties("info");

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo
